author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Notre Dame Basketball Charity Game vs. Purdue Fort Wayne on Oct. 30
text:
Notre Dame Basketball Charity Game vs. Purdue Fort Wayne on Oct. 30
The
Notre Dame men's basketball team is set to play a charity exhibition game against Purdue Fort Wayne on October 30, 7 p.m. ET, at the Allen County War Memorial Coliseum. Proceeds from the event will benefit Big Brothers Big Sisters of Northeast Indiana and the Boys and Girls Clubs of Fort Wayne. Tickets will be available starting at $12 on September 20. Notre Dame, currently leading their series 7-0, last faced Purdue Fort Wayne in 2016.
- Purdue Fort Wayne finished last season with a 23-13 record.
- Notre Dame has previously held a charity exhibition, raising funds for hurricane relief in 2017.
- Notre Dame is using the exhibition as a preseason tune-up ahead of the official season.
- Both benefiting organizations focus on mentorship and youth development in northeast Indiana.
Following the exhibition, the teams will continue their regular season schedules, with Notre Dame aiming for a strong showing to bolster their preseason preparations.Bottom Line
This charity game not only showcases collegiate basketball but also underscores Notre Dame's commitment to community engagement, highlighting the importance of mentorship and youth programs.
Read more at
 Notre Dame Fighting Irish - Official Athletics Website
